summary: The FBI's face recognition office can now search databases with more than 641 million photos, including 21 state databases. In a May 2016 report , we found the FBI hadn't fully adhered to privacy laws and policies or done enough to ensure accuracy of its face recognition capabilities. This testimony is an update on this work and our 6 recommendations, only one of which has...
title: Face Recognition Technology: DOJ and FBI Have Taken Some Actions in Response to GAO Recommendations to Ensure Privacy and Accuracy, But Additional Work Remains
